newsitem.title: CANADA: NHL-YASHIN TIES CLUB RECORD WITH TWO GOALS IN OTTAWA WIN.
newsitem.headline: NHL-YASHIN TIES CLUB RECORD WITH TWO GOALS IN OTTAWA WIN.

text.p: Alexei Yashin scored twice to tie a team record for goals in a single season and Ron Tugnutt made 22 saves as the Ottawa Senators beat the New York Islanders 4-1 on Friday.
Yashin's second goal, a wraparound midway through the second period, was his 30th of the season, tying the club mark he set in 1993-94.
"It's not just for me it's for the team," he said. "It's good to score goals but what matters is the win. If we score more goals, we probably win more often."
Shaun Van Allen and Tom Chorske also tallied for Ottawa, which moved within two points of the final Eastern Conference playoff spot.

"This is obviously a big game for us. We've got to keep going," said Tugnutt. "If we play well and win games like this it's not like we're going to catch (first place) Philly, but this is one of the teams we have to beat."
Claude Lapointe scored the only goal for the Islanders with 41 seconds left in the first period. But Yashin restored Ottawa's two-goal lead 9:32 into the second period.
At Washington, Paul Kariya and Teemu Selanne each had a goal and an assist to lead the Mighty Ducks of Anaheim to a 4-1 victory over the Capitals.
Andrew Brunette scored the lone Washington goal 1:20 into the second period. Kariya's 31st goal and 10th this month lifted the Ducks into a 1-1 tie with 81 seconds left in the period.
Selanne's 37th goal, a power-play tally at 7:06 of the third period, put Anaheim ahead to stay. The Finnish Flash one-timed a pass from Dmitri Mironov past Jim Carey for his 200th career goal.
Guy Hebert made 24 saves for Anaheim, while Carey finished with 29 stops as the Ducks outshot Washington 33-25.
In Hartford, Jeff Friesen scored with 2:18 remaining as the San Jose Sharks rallied in the third period for a 3-2 victory over the Whalers.
Friesen put home a rebound of Doug Bodger's point shot after it deflected off teammate Bob Errey. It was his 20th goal of the season and fourth in the last six games.
Rookie Steve Guolla beat goaltender Jason Muzzatti with a blast from the blue line on a power play at 7:05 of the third period to lift the Sharks into a 2-2 tie.
Geoff Sanderson scored both goals for Hartford. Shean Donovan had a short-handed tally in the second for San Jose.
In Calgary, Jonas Hoglund and Theo Fleury scored powerplay goals late in the first period and the Flames held on for a 3-2 victory over the Montreal Canadiens.
German Titov also scored for Calgary, which has won six of its last seven at home and moved into a tie with Chicago and Anaheim for seventh place in the Western Conference.
Fleury also assisted on Hoglund's goal and Jerome Iginla picked up two assists for the Flames.
Martin Rucinsky and Saku Koivu tallied for Montreal.
